channel.title: Want Free Music WITHOUT TORRENTING!?!
channel.description:
You can all use [url=http://albumbase.com]Albumbase[/url]
Your Welcome.
O and If you don't want to get caugth use TOR.
[url=http://tor.eff.org/download.html.en]Download[/url]
[url=http://tor.eff.org/index.html.en]What is TOR?[/url]

item.title: Want Free Music WITHOUT TORRENTING!?!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Mmmk:

Lol dumb. What kind of goverment is it? If its ua goverment they cant do shit to me because they dont rule the world omg

Extradition treaties… If you violate a copyright of a musician, a musician from the USA with copyrights in the USA, and you do get caught, they will extradite you from whatever country you’re from, to America to go to prison.

Some countries do not have extradition treaties with the USA such as… China, I’m pretty sure.

[quote=“Smarterchild, post:17, topic:12704”][quote author=tomo6627 link=topic=18827.msg278123#msg278123 date=1159526767]
If you use a proxy while using Limewire will you get caught or anything?
[/quote]

You don’t get caught on LimeWire anyways?[/quote]
Yes you can get caught with LimeWire. You can also get caught with any other P2P application, any torrent, any time you go to a website they can track you. Proxying would help but not much. The companies that provide you with the internet (Your ISP) will never ever get rid of their records! And they keep records of everythign that happens in the internet world. EVERYTHING! That’s how they caught the guy who came out with the melissa and MyDoom virus.

They keep track of everything. So it’s not, “Lol dumb” as Mmmk said. It’s very serious.

About 300 or so people a month get sued by the RIAA in all different countries! Oh also, if you live in a country that says you are allowed to download anything you want, then you’re fine. I think in the netherlands you can download but not share. So it all depends on the laws and the contry you live in and the musician you’re stealing from.

To be safe, just pay $1 per song and keep it safe. Don’t do anything illegal.

Read full topic

item.title: Want Free Music WITHOUT TORRENTING!?!
item.dc:creator: @jonckr jonckr
item.description:
@jonckr wrote:

Hey, afi, thanks… this really is cool, much better than limewire, don’t need to download song by song! ;D[br][size=1]Posted at: September 28, 2006, 08:27:38 AM[/size][hr][quote=“mindtempest, post:8, topic:12704”][quote author=Ron link=topic=18827.msg214538#msg214538 date=1157361536]
I’m sure the government and RIAA is packet sniffing that website to see who connects to it. That’s the only problem.

Very nice find though.
[/quote]
for chinese songs you can go to this china site called baidu which has a mp3 search, and 99% of the songs dl in under 5 mins, which completely pwns p2p transfers. it only exists cos the chinese govt is heck care abt piracy, unlike america. so far i dont know abt any sites that allow you to do such a thing for english songs.[/quote]
i think i have made a tutorial on that right?[br][size=1]Posted at: September 28, 2006, 08:54:47 AM[/size][hr][quote=“afi, post:14, topic:12704”][quote author=kuiren link=topic=18827.msg276030#msg276030 date=1159423063]
So could you get caught using albumbase?
[/quote]

You could but use Proxy, and a firewall.[/quote]
afi, can i ask u, can i just use a firewall to download the musics? is it safe to back it up with a proxy without USING TOR?

Read full topic

item.title: Want Free Music WITHOUT TORRENTING!?!
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:7, topic:12704”]James, LimeWire blows in so many ways compared to downloading the music right from a server.

With LimeWire you have all that bad data getting sent, trojans, viruses, bad quality music, NEED MORE SOURCES bs, and other problems.

And MoO it’s okay to go there is you proxy, run a firewall, and don’t have a computer that has any keyloggers nor viruses.

Btw, Edwin Starr’s CD rules, thanks a lot afi. :)[/quote]

No Problem, If only someone could say someting about my TOR links.

Read full topic

item.title: Want Free Music WITHOUT TORRENTING!?!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron

James, LimeWire blows in so many ways compared to downloading the music right from a server.

With LimeWire you have all that bad data getting sent, trojans, viruses, bad quality music, NEED MORE SOURCES bs, and other problems.

And MoO it’s okay to go there is you proxy, run a firewall, and don’t have a computer that has any keyloggers nor viruses.

Btw, Edwin Starr’s CD rules, thanks a lot afi.
